item.title: Using Terraform to manage Kubernetes
item.description: When working with kubernetes the standard way to create objects such as pods, deployments and services is to create a yaml manifest file that describes the desired state and then use kubectl to create/update the object. Althought, straightforward this process might create a barrier for developers and operations teams that now have to mantain a new codebase in a new “language”. YAML is easy to read but troubleshooting it might be difficult due the need for correct identation and the errors that are exibithed by kubectl might not be easily understood.
